{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3490460,"name":"","username":"KevinLeep","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-23T04:18:04.384Z","cooked":"

Our team has been using Pathplanner without any problems since the 2024 season. However, because robots start in the middle of the field this season, we wanted our robot path to start facing toward our alliance zone/reef.

We made a path for blue with an ideal starting state with 0 velocity and 180 degrees of rotation that goes in a straight line toward the blue alliance zone as seen in the gif.

However, when we run the path from a blue driverstation, the robot will instead drive in reverse (towards the red alliance) and attempts to rotate 180 degrees. Weirdly enough, when we run the blue path from a red driver station, the path works perfectly fine.

I have a video of this linked below. (At the start of the video we run the auto with our driverstation set to blue and after the cut, we rerun it with our driverstation set to red)

Auton video

I suspect the robot somehow thinks it’s facing the wrong direction and is attempting to auto-correct itself, but I don’t see any reason for it to do this, especially considering that the swerve drives completely normal in teleop or when the auto path starts at 0 degrees.

The actual pathplanner path file and the full codebase are on the github repository linked below. The code for creating the autobuilder is located in the Drivetrain file.

Github repo

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

we had this issue trying to implement pathplanner last year. your robot thinks it’s on the red side when you start it on the blue side so it tries to go over to the other side to run the path, probably because you mirror the field coordinates somewhere. pathplanner runs a blue-side origin always coordinate system so your code should match.

did you solve this problem? We’re having the exact same issue. From the dashboard, FMS says we are on blue and our route is the same as yours.

My team had this issue for a long time too.

We diagnosed the issue by displaying our Robots Pose2d on our Dashboard with a Field2d widget and watched how it drove.

If you try driving in the direction you want to be forward and it goes the wrong way, there’s your problem. Though keep in mind that you may be doing some kind of inversion in teleop to compensate for that already, which would be the crux of your issue.

We found out our drive was inverted only after starting to work on Limelight localization, and found our internal odometry fighting the limelight’s.

Hopefully this helps.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-28T02:48:22.752Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":46,"readers_count":45,"score":24.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483172,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-path-reverses-and-rotates-when-robot-starts-at-180-degrees","display_username":"Alexander Carlisi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62389,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-path-reverses-and-rotates-when-robot-starts-at-180-degrees/483172/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3494494,"name":"","username":"KevinLeep","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T04:27:41.732Z","cooked":"

We ended up finding the issue after looking through the code for a while. In our resetPose2d method, when we used the reset method on our odometry, we were passing the current heading through our getRotation2d method instead of the desired auto pose heading through pose.getRotation().

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-28T04:27:41.732Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":38.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483172,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-path-reverses-and-rotates-when-robot-starts-at-180-degrees","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":29208,"username":"wharrier2450","name":"Walter5653","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/b5e925/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71101,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8576 - Programming Officer"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-path-reverses-and-rotates-when-robot-starts-at-180-degrees/483172/5","custom_user_title":"8576 - Programming Officer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3495289,"name":"Walter5653","username":"wharrier2450","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/b5e925/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-29T01:56:31.870Z","cooked":"

Thank you. That did help. However, we also had our wheels zeroed in the wrong direction. After fixing these 2 things, we are in business.
